sect1.title: Betweenness Centrality
sect1.para:
Betweenness is a centrality measure for a node within a graph. A score for this betweenness is computed using the algorithm presented in the following
publication
by Ulrik Brandes.

The first column entitled "cid" gives the concept identifier. The second column entitled "concept name" indeed gives the concept name. The user can click on the "score" column to sort it in ascending or descending order.
Click on "Annotate Graph" and click anywhere in the visualisation window to see the results
Selecting the four highest scores highlights the corresponding concepts on the network.
After redrawing the layout of the graph (using GEM layout) and clicking on the first row of the table, the network can be zoomed in on the concept with the highest score using the "Zoom In" icon.
Finally, it is possible to export the results to an Excel file by using the "Export results" button.
